title: ImportError (undefined symbol: ...LongTensor) when importing torch
body_html:
Hi all,
I'm having a problem with importing torch after updated packages to latest. Here's trackback:
>>> import torch
Traceback (most recent call last):
File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
File "/home/ntomita/pytorch-env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/__init__.py", line 53, in <module> from torch._C import *
ImportError: /home/ntomita/pytorch-env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/_C.so: undefined symbol: _ZN4thpp10THCSTensorIlEC1EP8THCStateP14THCSLongTensor

I got this error after I updated pytorch/torchvision as follows
pytorch: 0.1.12-py27_0 --> 0.1.12-py27_2cu75 soumith
torchvision: 0.1.8-py27_0 --> 0.1.8-py27_2 soumith
using conda update pytorch torchvision -c soumith

Clean-install didn't help either. I believe there's something wrong with the latest package.

Is anybody had same problem? (I could roll back to older version but that version has a problem with torchvision.transforms.Scale, which says TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for /: 'list' and 'int' when feeding a list of int as a size. So I really want to use the latest modules.)
body_text:
Hi all,
I'm having a problem with importing torch after updated packages to latest. Here's trackback:
>>> import torch
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
 File "/home/ntomita/pytorch-env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/__init__.py", line 53, in <module> from torch._C import *
ImportError: /home/ntomita/pytorch-env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/_C.so: undefined symbol: _ZN4thpp10THCSTensorIlEC1EP8THCStateP14THCSLongTensor
I got this error after I updated pytorch/torchvision as follows
    pytorch:     0.1.12-py27_0 --> 0.1.12-py27_2cu75 soumith
    torchvision: 0.1.8-py27_0  --> 0.1.8-py27_2      soumith
using conda update pytorch torchvision -c soumith
Clean-install didn't help either. I believe there's something wrong with the latest package.
Is anybody had same problem? (I could roll back to older version but that version has a problem with torchvision.transforms.Scale, which says TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for /: 'list' and 'int' when feeding a list of int as a size. So I really want to use the latest modules.)
body:
Hi all,
I'm having a problem with importing torch after updated packages to latest. Here's trackback:
`>>> import torch`
`Traceback (most recent call last):`
`  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>`
 ` File "/home/ntomita/pytorch-env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/__init__.py", line 53, in <module>
    from torch._C import *`
`ImportError: /home/ntomita/pytorch-env/lib/python2.7/site-packages/torch/_C.so: undefined symbol: _ZN4thpp10THCSTensorIlEC1EP8THCStateP14THCSLongTensor`

I got this error after I updated pytorch/torchvision as follows
`    pytorch:     0.1.12-py27_0 --> 0.1.12-py27_2cu75 soumith`
`    torchvision: 0.1.8-py27_0  --> 0.1.8-py27_2      soumith`
using `conda update pytorch torchvision -c soumith`

Clean-install didn't help either. I believe there's something wrong with the latest package.

Is anybody had same problem? (I could roll back to older version but that version has a problem with torchvision.transforms.Scale, which says `TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for /: 'list' and 'int'` when feeding a list of int as a size. So I really want to use the latest modules.)
